Preclude.definition: to prevent or exclude by necessary consequence [the requirement of a marriage ceremony s the creation of common-law marriages in this jurisdiction]
Preclude.origin: [the requirement of a marriage ceremony s the creation of common-law marriages in this jurisdiction]

pre·clud·ing.definition: to prevent or exclude by necessary consequence [the requirement of a marriage ceremonythe creation of common-law marriages in this jurisdiction]

sub_terms.a: to prevent (a party) from litigating an action or claim esp. by collateral estoppel or res judicata [they areonly because they failed to assert…the grounds for recovery they now assert ", 595 F.2d 446 (1979)"]
sub_terms.b: to prevent (a claim or action) from being litigated esp. by collateral estoppel or res judicata [the Civil Service Reform Act provides the exclusive address for adverse federal employment actions and thusclaims brought under the Tort Claims Act ""]

pre·clud·ing.s: claims brought under the Tort Claims Act "
pre·clud·ing.precluded: only because they failed to assert…the grounds for recovery they now assert "
